thread.title: Police arrest man in connection with string of car break-ins
thread.title_full: Police arrest man in connection with string of car break-ins | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Police arrest man in connection with string of car break-ins
text:
Police arrested a man in connection with a string of car break-ins Sundays afternoon in Seattle.
Police said a witness called 911 at 1:15 p.m. to report seeing a man snooping around parked cars in the 1500 block of 23rd Avenue South.
According to police, the witness said the 65-year-old man smashed a car window, removed a water bottle, took a swig and tossed the container in nearby bushes while walking away.
When police arrived, they recovered the bottle for fingerprints.
Police then received another report of a car break-in just blocks away. The second caller reported a man removed a bag that held a handgun before running from the area.
As police were heading to the scene, they received a third report of a man smashing car windows near the 2800 block of South Massachusetts Street.
Officers arrived in the area and saw the man described in the three reports. When he spotted police, he ran, but was caught a few blocks away.
A K-9 unit searched for the stolen property and found the bag with the gun stashed in Coleman Playground.
The man was booked into the King County Jail for multiple counts of theft and property damage.
